Package controller

Class MultiDialogueController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.BaseController
      • controller.MultiDialogueController
  • public class MultiDialogueController
extends BaseController
    This class manages the conversation between the InfoBot and a user by prompting the user how and when to ask questions, and by keeping a record to see if it answers the user's questions correctly. If there are multiple matched answers, it will send back answers one at a time.

    • Method Detail

      • getInfo

        public Answer getInfo​(String question)
        This is the method used to manage the conversation between the InfoBot and a user. It sends the question asked by the user to the Parser, to get back the user's key words. The key words are then sent to the knowledge base to get a matching answer (or multiple answers) back.

        If there are multiple answers matching the user's question, this method will return one answer at a time back to the user, then, check to see if the answer is accepted by the user or not, if yes, it stops sending the rest of the potential matching answers to the user, if no, it keeps sending the rest of the answers to the user until it exhausts all the answers.

        It also handles many special conversational cases, such as greetings from users, empty questions, reseting the conversation, existing the program.

        Specified by:
        getInfo in class BaseController
        Parameters:
        question - The question the user asks
        Returns:
        Answer the answer to the user's question and its related information

      • rankAnswers

        private void rankAnswers​(ArrayList<Answer> answers)
        This method ranks the answers to the user's question based upon the number of key words matched, from the most to the least.
        Parameters:
        answers - The list of answers

      • checkGreetings

        private boolean checkGreetings​(String question)
        This method checks if the user is trying to greet the InfoBot or not.
        Parameters:
        question - The question asked by the user
        Returns:
        boolean if it is greeting from the user returns true, otherwise false
